content:
• Thursday, January 3, 2013
  • SONC

    More on Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ1 comes in line with estimates as same-store sales continue to...

    More on Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ1 comes in line with estimates as same-store sales continue to rise and costs declined for the quarter. However, the stock is down after hours as investors look at the longer term comps, which are trending lower. Shares -4.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY) +2.8% AH after: 1) Announcing it deployed 156MW of solar panels (+117% Y/Y),...

    SolarCity (SCTY) +2.8% AH after: 1) Announcing it deployed 156MW of solar panels (+117% Y/Y), above the company's expectation of 146MW. 85MW of the deployments involved residential installations, and 76MW commercial installations. 2) Guiding for 2013 deployments of 250MW (190MW residential, 60MW commercial). Shares are now at $13.38, well above SolarCity's (lowered) December IPO price of $8. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • NAVB

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NAVB +5%. ROVI +5%. SHLM +5%. UVXY +2%. SNTS...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NAVB +5%. ROVI +5%. SHLM +5%. UVXY +2%. SNTS +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ARAY -20%. VTNC -7%. SUSP -6%. ITMN -6%. FUN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) +5.2% AH after announcing it has hired an adviser to find a buyer for its...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) +5.2% AH after announcing it has hired an adviser to find a buyer for its struggling Entertainment Store business, which provides private-label solutions for selling digital content. Rovi is also now guiding for 2012 revenue of $645M-$655M and EPS of $2-$2.10 from continuing ops, compared with a consensus of $666.1M and $1.86. In May, the Entertainment Store was partly blamed for the company's Q1 miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • FIO

    Mellanox's warning fueled a gradual selloff in enterprise tech stocks. Some storage-centric...

    Mellanox's warning fueled a gradual selloff in enterprise tech stocks. Some storage-centric names were among the hardest-hit: FIO -6.2%. BRCD -4.7%. ELX -3.9%. XRTX -4.7%. Other notable decliners: FFIV -3.8%. CTXS -3.4%. VMW -3.2%. TIBX -3%. QLIK -8.4%. (security hardware stocks)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARAY

    More on Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY): In addition to the lowered guidance, the company also announces a...

    More on Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY): In addition to the lowered guidance, the company also announces a restructuring of operations to focus on improving commercial execution and sustainable revenue growth. The restructuring is expected to reduce staffing by approximately 13%, with most of the cuts coming from U.S.-based operations. As a result, ARAY plans to take a one-time charge of $3M to $4M in Q313, and expects operating expense savings of approximately $40M per year compared to FY12. Shares -19% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • ARAY

    Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY) cuts guidance, saying it now expects Q2 revenue in the range of $72M to...

    Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY) cuts guidance, saying it now expects Q2 revenue in the range of $72M to $75M, below analyst estimates of $93.7M. For FY 2013, the company expects revenue in the range of $320M to $330M and a loss of $0.87 to $0.95 per share. The Street is at $407M in revenue and a loss of $0.57 per share. The company blames the lower numbers on manufacturing and supply related issues, which delayed contribution from new products, and salesforce transitional issues. Shares -19% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) -4% AH after announcing CEO Paul Davis, 55, will retire on March 31, and...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) -4% AH after announcing CEO Paul Davis, 55, will retire on March 31, and will be replaced by CFO J. Scott Di Valerio. Redbox finance SVP Galen Smith will step in for Di Valerio as CFO. Coinstar adds it expects to report Q4 revenue within its previously-announced guidance range, and EPS "at or above the high end" of its guidance range thanks to lower G&A spending and Redbox tax benefits.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): Q4 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $121.7M beats by...

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): Q4 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $121.7M beats by $5.39M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • RBBN

    Sonus (SONS +2.6%) finished the day higher, and Acme Packet (APKT -5.1%) lower, after...

    Sonus (SONS +2.6%) finished the day higher, and Acme Packet (APKT -5.1%) lower, after Northland's Catharine Trebnick reported Verizon is deploying Sonus' session border controllers (SBCs) on the New York-Boston segment of its IP backbone. Acme, the SBC market's top vendor, has long counted Verizon as a major customer.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ2 EPS of $0.1 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $87.1M misses by $0.3M....

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ2 EPS of $0.1 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $87.1M misses by $0.3M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $126M (-1.5% Y/Y) misses by $0.29M....

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $126M (-1.5% Y/Y) misses by $0.29M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -4%) move to session lows after Nielsen tracking data indicates...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -4%) move to session lows after Nielsen tracking data indicates slowing growing in the energy drink market. The company saw 6.8% growth for a recent 4-week period, a mark which falls short of its 12-week average of 11.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • HUN

    Huntsman (HUN +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Citigroup, which believes lower TiO2 prices...

    Huntsman (HUN +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Citigroup, which believes lower TiO2 prices have been factored into HUN shares. The firm credits management for being the first to call out weakness in TiO2 amid destocking and margin pressure from the expiration of legacy annual titanium ore price contracts. The upgrade is targeted to patient investors willing to wait out the TiO2 destocking cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -2.2%) trades lower today on reports of some end-of-year related insider selling....

    Humana (HUM -2.2%) trades lower today on reports of some end-of-year related insider selling. Separately, the company announced that it's established a partnership with DuPage Medical Group to launch the BreakThrough Care Center. HUM touts the center as a comprehensive, holistic outpatient clinic designed to improve medical outcomes while lowering health care costs and improving patients' ability to manage their health conditions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • PANW

    Security hardware stocks are having a rough day: Palo Alto Networks (PANW -3.1%), Fortinet (FTNT...

    Security hardware stocks are having a rough day: Palo Alto Networks (PANW -3.1%), Fortinet (FTNT -7.8%), Sourcefire (FIRE -3.6%), and Check Point (CHKP -5%) are among the losers. Stephens has started coverage on Palo Alto with an Equal Weight and $50 PT; shares of the fast-growing and richly-valued next-gen firewall vendor fell 4.3% yesterday in the face of a giant tech rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -6.3%) slumps with a concern cropping that a fresh patent from Sony could block...

    GameStop (GME -6.3%) slumps with a concern cropping that a fresh patent from Sony could block pre-owned games on the PS4. Though Sterne Agee remarks a Sony-GameStop patent play isn't a "done deal" just yet, the prospect of the company getting locked out from selling used games for the PS4 device is creating anxiety.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) surges above $97 after BMO raises its PT to $88 from $65. The firm, which...

    Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) surges above $97 after BMO raises its PT to $88 from $65. The firm, which maintains a Market Perform, predicts Netflix will remain the dominant online streaming provider, and also expects further international expansion. 26.1% of the float was shorted as of Dec. 14, providing ample fuel for a short-covering rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare (THC +3%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform at Imperial Capital, citing...

    Tenet Healthcare (THC +3%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform at Imperial Capital, citing President Obama's reelection as well as several other key victories in the last election plus better visibility in its operational programs over the long term. The firm doubles its price target to $40 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth (UNH -3.3%) slides on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank. Deutsche cites a lack...

    UnitedHealth (UNH -3.3%) slides on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank. Deutsche cites a lack of catalysts in the managed care sector, which is weighed down by higher underwriting risks, declining pricing trends and margin pressures. The firm cuts its price target for shares to $61 from $73.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -15%) is off the AH lows it saw yesterday following its Q4 warning, but is still...

    Mellanox (MLNX -15%) is off the AH lows it saw yesterday following its Q4 warning, but is still having an ugly day. FBN has downgraded shares to Sector Perform, and UBS (Neutral) argues Mellanox's problems go well beyond the InfiniBand cabling issues partly blamed for the shortfall. The firm claims management told it sales to one major OEM customer (believed to be either H-P or IBM) missed expectations by $5M-$10M. Pac Crest is staying bullish; the firm thinks "InfiniBand adoption could double in the next to to three years."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • SPWR

    Midday top 10 gainers: SPWR +38%. VISN +30%. MDCI +20%. FORD +20%. OTC:BGMD +19%. TSL +19%. CRDC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SPWR +38%. VISN +30%. MDCI +20%. FORD +20%. OTC:BGMD +19%. TSL +19%. CRDC +19%. FOLD +19%. OTCQB:TELK +18%. JASO +16%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: LPH -73%. ALLT -23%. MLNX -14%. FDO -12%. AMPL -12%. TRIT -11%. PKT -10%. SSI -9%. LODE -9%. HPJ -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +6.2%) shares sustain gains following earlier headlines of a settlement of both...

    Transocean (RIG +6.2%) shares sustain gains following earlier headlines of a settlement of both civil and criminal charges with the DoJ over the 2010 Deepwater Horizon incident. RIG is expected to pay ~$1.4B; previous SEC disclosure had the company in talks for a $1.5B settlement. RIG has set aside ~$2B to cover pending Deepwater Horizon litigation. BP +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -3.6%) and Micron (MU +4.4%) head in opposite directions after Rambus is sanctioned...

    Rambus (RMBS -3.6%) and Micron (MU +4.4%) head in opposite directions after Rambus is sanctioned yet again for destroying documents relevant to its memory IP suits (previous). The latest ruling comes 14 months after a jury cleared Micron and Hynix of memory price-fixing to prevent the adoption of Rambus' RDRAM memory.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • EPRS

    Zalicus (ZLCS +9.5%) trades up today after saying it's initiated the second of two Phase 2a...

    Zalicus (ZLCS +9.5%) trades up today after saying it's initiated the second of two Phase 2a clinical studies with Z160, a selective N-type calcium channel blocker designed to potentially treat chronic neuropathic pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +4.8%) is expected to pay fines and penalties of ~$1.4B in a settlement with the...

    Transocean (RIG +4.8%) is expected to pay fines and penalties of ~$1.4B in a settlement with the Justice Department over the Deepwater Horizon accident, WSJ reports. BP +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +9.2%) shoots higher after SA's Daniel B. Ravicher makes note of a line in a Dec....

    Vringo (VRNG +9.2%) shoots higher after SA's Daniel B. Ravicher makes note of a line in a Dec. 21 Google legal filing in which it asks the court presiding over its battle with Vringo to postpone a ruling on the imposition of royalties so as to "give the parties an opportunity to negotiate post-judgment royalties." This leads Ravicher, a patent attorney, to think Google has conceded Vringo deserves royalties on AdWords sales. He also expects Google's request for a postponement to be denied.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 6 Comments
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks rack up a second straight day of big gains following Berkshire's $2B-$2.5B purchase...

    Solar stocks rack up a second straight day of big gains following Berkshire's $2B-$2.5B purchase of SunPower's (SPWR +29.8%) Antelope Valley projects and Lazard's subsequent upgrade. First Solar (FSLR +6.5%) enjoys an upgrade too, but it's faint praise; S&P Capital IQ lifts FSLR to Sell from Strong Sell. TSL +16.7%, STP +10.6%, LDK +14.5%, YGE +11.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • FIVE

    Shares of Five Below (FIVE -1%) can't get out of the way out of a selling off of discounters...

    Shares of Five Below (FIVE -1%) can't get out of the way out of a selling off of discounters kickstarted when Family Dollar posted disappointing FQ1 results and guidance for FQ2. Also feeling the margin pain is Fred's (FRED -2.5%) and Gordmans Stores (GMAN -0.7%) - while even Wal-Mart (WMT -1.2%) appears to be getting pulled into the fray.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • QRVO

    RF component makers TriQuint (TQNT +4.1%), RF Micro (RFMD +3.7%), and (to a lesser extent)...

    RF component makers TriQuint (TQNT +4.1%), RF Micro (RFMD +3.7%), and (to a lesser extent) Skyworks (SWKS +1.6%) trade higher after Longbow gives each of them a Buy rating. Skyworks and TriQuint have slumped since mid-September, which happens to be around when the iPhone 5 launched - both chipmakers have iPhone 5 power amplifier design wins. RF Micro, whose shares were more depressed at the time, has fared better.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +1.7%) declares two oil fields in the Campos Basin offshore Brazil holding an...

    Petrobras (PBR +1.7%) declares two oil fields in the Campos Basin offshore Brazil holding an estimated 350M barrels of oil commercially viable. But the fields are unlikely to help PBR shake off its recent production troubles, as they aren't expected to start producing crude oil until 2017, with initial development part of the company's $237B investment plan for 2012-16.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT -21.4%) and rival Procera (PKT -11.3%) plummet after Oppenheimer downgrades Allot to...

    Allot (ALLT -21.4%) and rival Procera (PKT -11.3%) plummet after Oppenheimer downgrades Allot to Perform and predicts a Q4 miss. The firm, which has been one of Allot's strongest supporters, says checks indicate European demand has slowed and that several U.S. projects have been completed early, leading to a revenue gap. It thinks Q4's book-to-bill could wind up below 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • LPIH

    The plunge in shares of Longwei Petroleum (LPH -55.2%) is attributed to a negative article from...

    The plunge in shares of Longwei Petroleum (LPH -55.2%) is attributed to a negative article from Geoinvesting.com, which writes that "the company's purported business operations are massively overstated and a brazen fraud, on an order of magnitude unmatched before by any China-based companies we have seen."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 6 Comments
  • F

    Shares of Ford (F +2%) break higher as investors warm up to the automaker's solid report on...

    Shares of Ford (F +2%) break higher as investors warm up to the automaker's solid report on December sales amid a backdrop of a stressed consumer. Looking at the year as a whole, the automaker saw its F-Series truck show a double-digit gain in sales growth while it made strides with its lineup of fuel-efficient smaller models. Once again, the laggard was the Lincoln brand which Ford plans to give a shot in the arm in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 5 Comments
  • ROST

    Shares of Ross Stores (ROST +6.9%) soar after the retailer beats the estimates of analysts with...

    Shares of Ross Stores (ROST +6.9%) soar after the retailer beats the estimates of analysts with its December sales report and increases its guidance for Q4. Amidst a tough environment, the retailer's management team executed well to help the company show an improvement in margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 3 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +9.3%) jumps to $1.54 on an upgrade to Neutral from Credit Suisse, which...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +9.3%) jumps to $1.54 on an upgrade to Neutral from Credit Suisse, which happens to be one of the underwriters (along with Goldman) for its recent debt refinancing deal. Separately, Alcatel says it will demo 12 new cloud service concepts at CES. Among them: energy management apps for utilities that can monitor/adjust home appliance use, and interactive tables for airports and train stations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 4 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx (KERX -3.6%) notes that the Taxpayer Relief Act delays by two years, until January 2016,...

    Keryx (KERX -3.6%) notes that the Taxpayer Relief Act delays by two years, until January 2016, the inclusion of oral-only dialysis-related drugs in the money that Medicare pays facilities in a single bundle for dialysis treatment. Keryx CEO Ron Bentsur says this is a good thing for the firm's Zerenex drug, although investors don't seem to be convinced. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPWR

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) +16.4% premarket after Lazard raises shares to Buy from Neutral with an...

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) +16.4% premarket after Lazard raises shares to Buy from Neutral with an $11 price target, saying investors are overlooking the stock that has "strong sales visibility" and the ability to turn in "healthy returns despite a highly competitive solar market." SPWR also enjoys a boost from the $2B-$2.5B sale of its California solar development to MidAmerican Renewables.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Miller Tabak raises its price target on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) to $360 from $335 while maintaining...

    Miller Tabak raises its price target on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) to $360 from $335 while maintaining a solid Buy rating on the restaurant operator. Meanwhile, Jefferies has the other side of the trade, noting pressure from Taco Bell will pressure sales and margins. CMG -1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 4 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures remain down following mixed jobs data (I, II) and after rising...

    Market preview: Stock futures remain down following mixed jobs data (I, II) and after rising sharply yesterday in reaction to the fiscal cliff deal. The S&P benchmark is flat to lower. Family Dollar dives 9% in the wake of its FQ1 report, while Limited Brands tumbles 4.4% following December sales data, although Nordstrom is +3.5% and Ross +5.25%. Biogen sinks 5.8% after its treatment for Lou Gehrig's disease fails in Phase III trials. Later: ISM New York Business Index, Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, FOMC minutes

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • TJX

    TJX (NYSE:TJX) Dec. same-store sales: +6%. Total sales +10% to $3.6B. Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)

    TJX (NYSE:TJX) Dec. same-store sales: +6%. Total sales +10% to $3.6B. Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • TJX

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) gain 2.4% premarket after the company's December sales easily...

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) gain 2.4% premarket after the company's December sales easily outpace the estimate of analysts. For the full year, the retailer bumps up its projection of EPS to $2.50-$2.51.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • BGMD

    Premarket gainers: OTC:BGMD +22%. SPWR +16%. ALU +10%. CBMX +10%. FOLD +8%. TASR +6%. LDK +6%....

    Premarket gainers: OTC:BGMD +22%. SPWR +16%. ALU +10%. CBMX +10%. FOLD +8%. TASR +6%. LDK +6%. ZGNX +5%.
    Losers: MLNX -18%. ALLT -10%. FDO -10%. KERX -6%. BIIB -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom's (NYSE:JWN) December sales: Compared to peers, Nordstrom's 8.6% rise in comparable...

    Nordstrom's (NYSE:JWN) December sales: Compared to peers, Nordstrom's 8.6% rise in comparable store sales looks downright frothy as both full-price (Nordstrom) and discounted stores (Nordstrom Rack) contributing to results. On a pre-recorded sales call, the company noted strength in the Midwest and South and said sales were strong during the last week of the month. On expansion, 15 stores were added to Nordstrom's total store count compared to a year ago led by expansion of Nordstrom Rack. JWN +3.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) +5.8% after saying its Relday treatment for schizophrenia had a good...

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) +5.8% after saying its Relday treatment for schizophrenia had a good safety and PK (pharmacokinetic - what the body does to the drug) profile in a Phase I study, which will now be extended for increased doses. Durect (NASDAQ:DRRX) is also on watch, as Zogenix has licensed Durect's technology for use in Relday. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • KSS

    Kohl (NYSE:KSS) Dec. same-store sales: +3.4%. Total sales +4% to $3.4B. Shares -3.5% premarket. (PR)

    Kohl (NYSE:KSS) Dec. same-store sales: +3.4%. Total sales +4% to $3.4B. Shares -3.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • ROST

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) Dec. same-store sales +6%. Total sales +11% to $1.27B. Shares +4%...

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) Dec. same-store sales +6%. Total sales +11% to $1.27B. Shares +4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • FDO

    Shares of Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) fall 8.5% premarket after the retailer puts in a dismal...

    Shares of Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) fall 8.5% premarket after the retailer puts in a dismal quarter and slides its estimates for FQ2 lower. An emphasis by the company on lower margin items such as cigarettes and soft drinks put a serious crimp on its ability to turn a profit. Peers premarket: DG -3.8%, DLTR -2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD) rockets 24% after saying it has received the EU's CE mark for the first...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD) rockets 24% after saying it has received the EU's CE mark for the first automated version of the company's Galectin-3 blood test for improving the management of heart conditions. BG is working with four partners to commercialize the test, including Abbott Labs (NYSE:ABT) and Siemens (SI). The EU approval comes just a week after SA author Robert Fabian called BG Medicine a "hidden gem." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • TGT

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) December sales: CEO Gregg Steinhafel notes the flat performance of...

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) December sales: CEO Gregg Steinhafel notes the flat performance of comparable store sales growth came as a result of late strength which was just enough to offset a soft first three weeks. Due to the sluggishness, Target estimates Q4 EPS will meet or exceed slightly the low end of its guidance. A new $1B buyback plan is authorized by the company. TGT +2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) Dec. same-store sales: flat%. Total sales +0.8% to $10.2B. Shares +2.5%...

    Target (NYSE:TGT) Dec. same-store sales: flat%. Total sales +0.8% to $10.2B. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB) -5.8% after reporting the failure of its dexpramipexole drug for...

    Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB) -5.8% after reporting the failure of its dexpramipexole drug for treating people with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), which is also known as Lou Gehrig's disease and which affects the nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord that control muscle movement. The medicine didn't meet its primary goals of improving "function and survival," nor did it meet any key secondary endpoints. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M) Dec. same-store sales: +4.1%. Total sales +3.6% to $5.1B. Shares +1.5%...

    Macy's (NYSE:M) Dec. same-store sales: +4.1%. Total sales +3.6% to $5.1B. Shares +1.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • FDO

    More on Family Dollar's (NYSE:FDO) FQ1: The retailer cites increased gross margin pressure and...

    More on Family Dollar's (NYSE:FDO) FQ1: The retailer cites increased gross margin pressure and higher insurance expenses as negative factors on earnings during the quarter which offset a brisk 6.6% gain in comparable store sales. Execs noted the holiday season was "more challenging" than expected. SG&E expenses as a percentage of sales fell 30 bps to 28.9%. The company sees FQ2 EPS of $1.18-$1.28 vs. consensus of $1.39. Shares -4.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 AM

  • Like European shares, U.S. stock futures are suffering a bit after partying hard yesterday...

    Like European shares, U.S. stock futures are suffering a bit after partying hard yesterday following the fiscal cliff deal. Dow -0.15%, S&P -0.3% and Nasdaq -0.1%. Meanwhile, crude is -0.6%, gold -0.4% and silver -0.3%, although copper is +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 AM

  • Asian shares are broadly higher, building on strong gains yesterday following Congress' passing...

    Asian shares are broadly higher, building on strong gains yesterday following Congress' passing of the fiscal cliff deal, with accelerated growth in China's services industries helping to keep sentiment positive. Japan closed, Hong Kong -0.1%, China closed, India +0.2%, Australia +0.7% to 4,740.7, its highest close since May 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 AM
